page.title: Nominal Phrases - Possessor Agreement
page.introduction:
Possessor agreement normally comes in two basic forms:
An affix that occurs on alienably possessed nouns to indicate that they are possessed and therefore must have a possessor in the nominal phrase. Inalienably possessed nouns do not take any marking, but must always have a possessor. These include, but are not limited to, kinship terms and body parts.
An affix that agrees with the possessor (or possibly expresses the possessor by itself).
We will deal with each type in turn.

radioGroup.prompt: Does your language distinguish between alienably and inalienably possessed nouns?

form.prompt:
Enter the affix(es) which are used to mark alienably possessed nouns when they have a possessor in the box (each on a separate line if more than one). Use a hyphen after the alphabetic characters to indicate a prefix, a hyphen before to indicate a suffix, and hyphens on both sides to indicate an infix.
Please note that these affixes should not be the same as those that agree with or express the possessor, discussed below.
form.instruction: Key the feature possessed on the affix(es) that marks the alienably possessed nouns when they have a possessor. Also, key the feature possessed on all inalienably possessed nouns so that a possessor will be required.

radioGroup.prompt:
Are nouns marked with an affix which agrees with the possessor (or possibly expresses the possessor by itself)? These affixes are assumed to be the set of dependent pronouns used for possessors which will be entered in
Pronouns.

form.prompt:
Look through the features in the chart below and check any that your language uses. For class agreement, either a type or number should be used in the grammar output to replace the ## below.
person poss_first the possessor must be first person
poss_exclusive the possessor must be first person exclusive
poss_inclusive the possessor must be first person inclusive
poss_second the possessor must be second person
poss_third the possessor must be third person
number poss_singular the possessor must be singular in number
poss_plural the possessor must be plural in number
poss_dual the possessor must be dual in number
gender poss_masculine the possessor must be masculine in gender
poss_feminine the possessor must be feminine in gender
poss_neuter the possessor must be neuter in gender
animacy poss_animate the possessor must be animate
poss_inanimate the possessor must be inanimate
poss_human the possessor must be human
poss_nonhuman the possessor must be nonhuman
class poss_class_## the possessor must be class ##
form.instruction:
In the lexicon, add one or more features from the following list as appropriate to the affix entries. For class agreement, replace the ## with the appropriate class type or number up to 25 on the appropriate entries in the lexicon.
Note that this possessor agreement, at least in person features, cannot be tested until pronoun possessors are added in
Pronouns.

If you followed instructions, any agreement marking on nouns for number, gender, animacy and/or class should have already been done in the section on Articles and Demonstratives. If not, return there to complete the feature marking in the lexicon, before continuing on.
